title.value: Роль 5-аминолевулиновой кислоты в формировании устойчивости растений картофеля (Solanum tuberosum) к действию низких температур
The role of 5-aminolevulinic acid in formation of potato (Solanum tuberosum) tolerance to low temperature

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Nedved, E.L., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering

abstract.value: Temperature appears one of the most important factors, determining plant growth and development. Low temperature negatively influences plant physiological processes, causing damage and death. 5-aminolevulinic acid (ALA) represents natural metabolic agent, increasing plant resistance to aggressive environment, declining oxidative processes and improving antioxidant ferment activity. The effect of exogenous 5-aminolevulinic acid (ALA) on the potato (Solanum tuberosum) tolerance to low temperature stress is studied and presented in the article. Comparison between potato plants treated with ALA and control ones is made and displayed. Chlorophyll and proline content in both types of the potato plants is analyzed.  It is shown that ALA (1 mg/l) under exogenous application improves potato tolerance to low temperatures (-4+-1 Celsius degree, for 1 h), that is evident from maintaining plant leaf blades turgor, reduction in the intensity of lipid peroxidation as well as the extent of cell membranes damage. In addition, ALA in concentration 1 mg/l contributes to the accumulation of proline and photosynthetic pigments in potato under normal and stress conditions.
